metadata.metaValue:
This node is adding the start/end frames as metadata to the stage.  
It can be useful for applications like *usdview* who are setting their timeline using such information.
The stage is saved at frame 30. All the previous time samples will be saved too. This is because the **add_to_animated_stage** compound is using a feedback port.

# The "mushroom_generator" compound simulate a new Bifrost mesh at each frame.  

The **Define Mesh** compound uses the new Bifrost mesh and the new color property at each frame to define a USD mesh with varying topology.

# The "add_to_animated_stage" stores time samples
This compound wrap an **add_to_stage** node in order to set its
*out_stage* output port feedback to the *stage* input port. This way the stage adds new time samples at each frames.
We store the stage in a Bifrost Object to show that you can evaluate the *USD nodes graph* without outputting a stage to Maya USD.
# Generates an animated USD mesh with varying topology from a Bifrost aero simulation
Generates an animated USD mesh with varying topology from a Bifrost aero simulation.
